title: Monkey Monkey Bottle of Beer (1974)
description:
Monkey Monkey Bottle of Beer, How many Monkeys Have We Here?  (1974)

From The Broadway Theatre Archive presented on PBS Theatre In America
  A Kultur dvd
	
Originally produced in 1974 as a segment of the PBS series Theater in America.

Credits

written by Marsha Sheiness
directed by Harold Scott and Peter Levin
 	
Video, Victor Caravella, Jr. ; 
cameramen, Walter Edel, 
Martin Gross, 
Frank Polizzotto ; 
videotape editor, John J. Godfrey.
 	
Host, Hal Holbrook  (this file does not have the Holbrook introduction.)

Cast 	
    Diane Danzi,
    Rosemary DeAngelis,
    Jean DeBaer, 
    Helene Friedman,
    Deloris Gaskins, 
    Marc Jefferson,
    Peggy Kirkpatrick,
    Dino Shorte.

Summary 
	
   The title of this play is taken from a little-known nursery rhyme involving 
a game between mother and child. The drama opens in an elegant reception room 
of a clinic where five women await a first reunion with their children from 
whom they have been separated for two months. 

   And from the Samuel French acting edition of the text:

    This psychological mystery is set in the waiting room of a clinic where 
five mothers await word on the futures of their mentally retarded children. 
They have been given the opportunity to change their children into geniuses.

My notes

  I have never forgotten this play.

  It was originally broadcast on PBS television's  Theatre in America and
produced at the Cincinnati Playhouse.  This is why I've added it to my file 
share since it is not available elsewhere on the torrent system.

  The subject , that of treatment of children with disorders and the style is 
completely unexpected and therefore mesmerizing.  I give away nothing in this 
play.  But it is a pity that it is not performed at all so far as I know.  

There is not even a wiki reference for it.  Perhaps this instance of the play
on video will prompt new productions for new audiences. 

   Encourage your libraries and theatre departments to get it from Kultur
Video and explore the work of Marsha Sheiness.   The acting edition of the text 
is available.

Notes written October 14th  2016
